abstract: Kyrgyzstan is poised to hold its first presidential election year and a half after bloody overthrow of authoritarian president and explosion of ethnic violence that left hundreds dead; many in small, landlocked country are eager to re-establish ties with Russia over what they see as United States' temporary strategic interest.
snippet: The small, landlocked country’s proximity and historical ties to Russia may prevail over what many in Kyrgyzstan see as the United States’ temporary strategic interest.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces

lead_paragraph: The small, landlocked country’s proximity and historical ties to Russia may prevail over what many in Kyrgyzstan see as the United States’ temporary strategic interest.

headline.main: Kyrgyzstan Votes for a President, Feeling the Pull of Russia
headline.print_headline: As Kyrgyzstan Votes, Some Consider a Turn to Russia
